definition: walking corpse (idiom)/zombie/person who lives only on the material level
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
corpse
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
meat/flesh/pulp (of a fruit)/(coll.) (of a fruit) squashy/(of a person) flabby/irresolute/Kangxi radical 130

sentences.english: When Donald Trump watches The Walking Dead, he thinks of us.
sentences.chinese: 川普看美劇《行屍走肉》的時候會想到我們。

sentences.english: But I look like the good-for-nothing to be ordinary, at home shakes, keeps silent.
sentences.chinese: 而我則像行屍走肉一般，在家裏晃悠，不言不語。

sentences.english: Many investors are walking around like zombies.
sentences.chinese: 很多投資者像行屍走肉一般沒頭腦。

sentences.english: I am now tired look like a good-for-nothing.
sentences.chinese: 我現在累得像一具行屍走肉。

sentences.english: No wonder now zombies are synonymous with being Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 無怪乎“行屍走肉”成了中國人的定義同義語。

sentences.english: We have so many people walking around who are dead an d don't even know it.
sentences.chinese: 在我們周圍有那麼多行屍走肉般的人，他們卻不自知。

sentences.english: The unspeakable truth is that we should not try and outlive our usefulness.
sentences.chinese: 這個可怕的事實是我們不應該試圖如行屍走肉般存在。

sentences.english: Being a mindless zombie can make you more likely to take things for granted.
sentences.chinese: 像一個沒頭腦的行屍走肉一樣讓你更容易忽略事情。

sentences.english: The Walking Dead comic and TV show have been a success.
sentences.chinese: 《行屍走肉》的漫畫和電視秀一直辦的很成功。

sentences.english: You don't have a dream, you lifeless creatures.
sentences.chinese: 你甚至都沒有夢想，你這個行屍走肉。

sentences.english: Ultimately, you feel like you are wandering through life without purpose.
sentences.chinese: 最後，你覺得自己如行屍走肉一般生活毫無目標。

sentences.english: Welcome back to the second season of The Walking Dead.
sentences.chinese: 歡迎大家回到《行屍走肉》第二季。

sentences.english: Lao Tze, world a, smelly Taoist priest, putrefied walking corpse, smelly.
sentences.chinese: 老子，天下第一，臭道士，腐爛的行屍走肉，臭。

sentences.english: Ultimately, you feel like you’re wandering through life without purpose.
sentences.chinese: 最後，你覺得自己猶如行屍走肉，失去生活目標。

sentences.english: So this city is as eye-catching fashion walking corpses as puppets.
sentences.chinese: 於是這座城市裏觸目便是行屍走肉般的時尚傀儡。

definition: handicapped person/useless person
one's thoughts in a whirl (idiom); confused/disconcerted/upset
sighing voice, wailing breath (idiom)/to heave deep sighs/to sigh in despair
the moth flies into the flame/fatal attraction
not one good point/everything about it is wrong
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
different routes to the same destination (idiom); fig. different means of achieve the same end
to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
Jiang Yan has exhausted his talent (idiom)/fig. to have used up one's creative powers/to have writer's block
panic-stricken
hanging one's head dispiritedly (idiom); dejected/crestfallen
lit. the path exhausted, the end of the road (idiom); an impasse/in a plight with no way out/things have reached a dead end
to be cynical/to be embittered
maggot
nocturnal/to hide by day and come out at night
(idiom) impossible to fault/impeccable
